GapFillDragDrop.ContentGapFillDragDrop: The next two years are going to bevery exciting for the town of Denbury. At a meeting last night, Mrs Alicia Galton, Mayor of Denbury, announced her intentionsfor the next three years. The town is going tospend over 10 million pounds on new projects. The first is a new shopping centre in the suburbs. It is going to havemore than 30 different shops and parking spaces for 200 cars. 'It'sgoing to be the best shopping centre in the area', said the Mayor, 'and we're going to builda new gym and swimming pool next to the shopping centre.' The Mayor also talked about projects for the centre of town. There is going to bea new museum in the old shoe factory, and a new library is going to opennear the bus station. 'We want people to enjoy the history and culture of our town,' said Mrs Galton,' So we're goingto have a local history section in the new museum, and we're going to showlots of photos of the old town.'
